de.esoco.lib.comm

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.comm.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RunCheck, Stoppable, de.esoco.lib.property.Fluent<Server>, java.lang.Runnable, org.obrel.core.FluentRelatable<Server>, org.obrel.core.Relatable, org.obrel.core.RelationBuilder<Server>

    public class Server
extends org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
implements org.obrel.core.RelationBuilder<Server>, java.lang.Runnable, RunCheck, Stoppable
    A server that listens on a socket for requests. To create a new instance the constructor expects an instance of Server.RequestHandlerFactory. This factory must then return new instances of the Server.RequestHandler interface which will be invoked to perform the client request by analyzing the request data from an input stream and writing the response data to an output stream.

    A server is started by invoking the run() method. A running server can be stopped by invoking stop() and it's current state can be queried with isRunning(). The configuration of a server is done by settings relations on it before it is started. The only mandatory relation is StandardTypes.PORT containing the port on which the server will listen. Optional configuration parameters are:

    • StandardTypes.NAME: the name of the server. Will be used as identifier in log output (default: simple class name).
    • CommunicationRelationTypes.MAX_REQUEST_SIZE: the maximum size of client requests. Requests exceeding this size will be rejected.
    • CommunicationRelationTypes.MAX_RESPONSE_SIZE: the maximum size of a response to a request.
    • CommunicationRelationTypes.ENCRYPTION: if set to TRUE the server will only accept encrypted connections. In that case the following additional configuration parameters may be set:
      • SecurityRelationTypes.KEY_PASSWORD: the password for private keys in any of the key stores mentioned below (default: empty string).
      • SecurityRelationTypes.CERTIFICATE: a Java KeyStore containing the server certificate and the corresponding private key, stored under the alias Security.ALIAS_SERVER_CERT. If not provided a certificate will be generated automatically under consideration of the following optional parameters.
      • SecurityRelationTypes.SIGNING_CERTIFICATE: used to sign an automatically generated certificate (typically some kind of self-signed certificate authority). If not set a self-signed certificate will be generated.
      • StandardTypes.HOST: the host name of the server. Will be used as the common name of a generated certificate (default: 'localhost').
      • SecurityRelationTypes.KEY_SIZE: the bit size of the private key for the TLS certificate (default: 2048).
      • SecurityRelationTypes.CERTIFICATE_VALIDITY: the validity period of a generated certificate in days (default: 30).

      static interface  Server.RequestHandler
      Defines the interface that needs to be implemented for server request handlers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(Server.RequestHandlerFactory rRequestHandlerFactory)
        Creates a new instance with a certain type of request handler. The request handler class must a have a no-argument constructor to allow the creation of new instances for each request.
        Parameters:
        rRequestHandlerFactory - The class of the request handler to use for client requests

    • Method Detail

      • isRunning

        public final boolean isRunning()
        Checks whether this server is currently running.
        Specified by:
        isRunning in interface RunCheck
        Returns:
        TRUE if the server is running, FALSE if it has been stopped (or not started yet)

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts this server instance on the port that is stored in the relation StandardTypes.PORT. The server will listen to incoming client requests and process each in a separate thread. The call to this method will block while the server is running. To control a running server (e.g. to stop it through the stop() method) an application must start the server in a separate thread.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Throws:
        CommunicationException - If a communication error occurs

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops this server after all active client threads have finished. This method will return immediately after the call, even if client requests are still processed.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Stoppable

      • createRequestContext

        protected org.obrel.core.Relatable createRequestContext()
        Creates a configuration object for the client requests. The default implementation returns a new Relatable object with the copied relations of this server.
        Returns:
        The relatable configuration object

      • createServerSocket

        protected java.net.ServerSocket createServerSocket(int nPort)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates the server socket to listen on when the server is started.
        Parameters:
        nPort - The port to listen on
        Returns:
        The new server port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the socket could not be created

      • handleClientRequest

        protected void handleClientRequest(java.net.Socket rClientSocket,
                                   org.obrel.core.Relatable rContext)
        Handles a single client request. This method will be run in a separate thread and the given socket is initialized for communication with the client.
        Parameters:
        rClientSocket - The socket for the communication with the client
        rContext - A relatable containing context data for the request
        Throws:
        CommunicationException - If a communication error occurs

      • runServerLoop

        protected void runServerLoop()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Runs the main server loop that listens for client requests and handles them with the current request handler.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If accessing the input or output streams fails
